title: Folder cannot be compacted (bug1959858)

Verify that you have enough disk space, and that you have write privileges to the file system, then try again." What does this mean and what can I do to fix it. Thanks. M. Campbell
creator: MilusC1

title: Not getting choose user profile window even though unchecked the box
content:
Running Thunderbird 140.0.1esr (64bit) on Windows 11 Dell desktop.

Have had two active mail profiles running for years, one for each of us in the family. Some weird things are taking place now.

This afternoon when initiating Thunderbird by selecting Thunderbird icon on the task bar as always do, Thunderbird began going directly to my profile, not bringing up the 'Thunderbird - Choose User Profile' window. This has happened previously and I got instruction on the forum how to resolve, so I did that resolution again.

I ran Thunderbird.exe -p in the RUN box .

It bought up the 'choose user profile' window so I UNCHECKED the box 'use the selected profile without asking at startup.' I guess somehow it got inadvertently checked. I expected this to resolve the problem. Note: When the box came up the first time I did NOT notice the names of the profiles offered, ours or the default ones mentioned below.

Now, when I initiate Thunderbird by selecting the icon in the task bar or selecting the icon on the desktop or selecting Thunderbird in the START list of apps -- it still goes directly to my profile not bringing up the 'Choose User Profile' window. HOWEVER, when I enter in the RUN box either thunderbird.exe or thunderbird.exe -p it brings up the 'Choose User Profile' window.

BUT -- the profiles offered are default and default.esr. They are not our two profiles we have been running for years. Our two profiles are still in the Thunderbird Profiles directory as seen with File Explorer. Hovering over default and default.esr shows their respective paths to the Thunderbird Profiles directory. (Cannot edit these paths.) But using File Explorer, these two profiles (default and default.esr) are NOT seen in the Profiles directory at all.

Question: 1. How do I get Thunderbird to function correctly. That is, when selecting the Thunderbird icon it brings up the 'Choose User Profile' showing our two profiles, and when I RUN Thunderbird.exe in the RUN window it ALSO shows our two profiles in the 'Choose User Profile' window, and NOT that default and default.esr profiles which I don't even see in the Profiles directory.

One more thing -- I have been thinking of switching over and installing the Thunderbird Release Channel -- If I installed it, would these problems carryover or would they be resolved? Thank you.

Added this note: In the past when the box 'use the selected profile without asking at startup' got inadvertently check and I resolved the problem by running thunderbird.exe -p, I was not running the Thunderbird version I am running now. It was back on 9/22/24 and I forgot what version it was but I don't think it was the ESR version back then. Maybe that is why running this command worked back on 9/22/24, but getting weird results now with the current esr version running. Thank you again.
creator: jpwvols

title: New Thunderbird changed my display layout, against my desires
content: Up until yesterday (2025/07/18) My display was set up with two columns: the left column was a hierarchy of folders and sub-folders; the right column had two sections: a list of messages (subject, size, from, date) in its upper section; and the text of the currently-selected message in its lower section. With this update (2025/07/19) my display is divided into three columns. The left column is still a hierarchy of folders. The center column is a list of messages. The right column is the text of the currently-selected message. This is awkward: I must choose between making the center column too thin to show all the message metadata (subject, size, from, date) or making the right column too thin to easily read the message text. How do I restore the text-below-messages layout that I want? Thank you.
creator: franklinccoleman

title: Continual, repetitive interruptions to demand access
content: Every few minutes Mozilla Thunderbird interrupts my work by posting a pair, one after the other, of a request to grant access to my Google account. See screen-save image attached. It pretends to give me the choice of "Allow" or "Deny", but when I click "Deny" it simply waits a few minutes and then comes back again. This is insulting and frustrating. How do I make it stop? (Other than clicking "Allow", that is, as I DO NOT WANT to grant access for the list of dangerous purposes provided in the pop-up.) Thank you.

title: Sync Thunderbird to Gmail
content:
I have looked in the support section and find the suggested articles confusing so this is what I am trying to accomplish.

I wish all messages stored and deleted on Thunderbird to be reflected on the gmail server. So ... if I delete a message in Thunderbird that will be automatically deleted on the gmail server. Easy. I guess this is settings. But the challenge is which settings to play with.

If it is relevant ... I have many folders set up on the Thunderbird client which are not on the gmail server.

Any help really welcome.
creator: cnxpeter

title: Set Bold Fonts Throughout Thunderbird?
content:
I have visual issues and cannot read thin text. I am trying to set up a Windows machine where it defaults to thin text. Yes, both Windows and Thunderbird allow users to increase font size and scaling, but I don't have enough screen size. It's much more helpful to increase font weight, and only somewhat increase some font sizes.

I already have /* Global UI font */

  • { font-family: Andika !important; }
  • { font-size: 12pt !important; }
  • {font-weight: bolder !important;}

Which makes the message list good and bold, and

  1. threadTree tr[data-properties~="unread"] {

color: red !important; }

Which distinguishes unread messages.

But for whatever reason, the fix doesn't extend to the messages or the settings page.

title: Fehler beim Starten von Thunderbird: Side-by-Side-Konfiguration ungültig
content:
Hallo,

ich bekomme beim Starten von Thunderbird (bzw. beim Anklicken der Taskleisten-Verknüpfung) folgende Fehlermeldung:

„Diese Anwendung konnte nicht gestartet werden, da die Side-by-Side-Konfiguration ungültig ist. Weitere Informationen finden Sie im Anwendungsereignisprotokoll. Weitere Details können auch mit dem Befehlszeilentool sxstrace.exe angezeigt werden.“

Ich nutze Windows 10. Thunderbird wurde möglicherweise gelöscht oder ist beschädigt. Wie kann ich den Fehler beheben?

Danke für eure Hilfe!

title: Switching from POP to IMAP with GMail account(s)
content:
I've been a TB user for 10+ years and been using POP with two GMail accounts. I have my TB set-up such that eMAIL is downloaded to my laptop and then sorted into LOCAL Folders by using Message Filters. Everything works.

I now have a desktop as well as my laptop. I've been told that it would be a much better idea to switch to IMAP for both machines (I use TB on both). If I do, I have a few questions:

  1. Numbered list item Can I still copy from my "Inbox" to a set of Local Folders and use Message Filters to sort my eMAIL by sender?
  2. Numbered list item Can I use a "unified" Inbox on each machine, as opposed to having two different Inboxes for my two GMail accounts?
  3. Numbered list item Is there a guide for new IMAP users as to how to set this up?

TIA
creator: andorjkiss

creator: blu99

title: Moving messages and repairing folders in Thunderbird
content:
For some time I have been having problems with moving or copying messages between folders in TB - I am on the esr channel and have just moved from 128.12 to 140.1 but nothing changed until I saw in a post on this forum that repairing the folder could make a difference. I have tried the repair folder option and it mostly works but not always - for example I couldn't copy or move messages from a sub-folder on one email account to a sub-sub-folder on another. It finally worked when I moved the messages to the folder above the one I wanted, and then moved them down, which was very time-consuming. And now it is once more refusing to copy a single message to a folder on another account.

Something that may not be helping is the fact that I am trying to copy messages to a new account, which has weirdly placed itself right at the bottom of the navigation list, below Local Folders and a news-server.

All the messages seem present and correct on my mailserver, where the recalcitrant folder is neatly in its alphabetical order.

Does TB just get bored? Does its memory clog up? Should I clear 'recent history' (whatever that is?)

Hoping someone can shed some light on what has been a very frustrating process of trial and error.

Kate

And PS when will we see 'Manually Move Folders' in the esr channel? I am now on 140 and thought that would have it...
creator: kmqbdaisy

title: Getting machine language above the orginal message text when I am replying to that message
content:
As per the subject - all of a sudden in my replies, I see machine language above the text of the original email I am replying to?

I have checked and unchecked Message Body options - but the machine language remains in the reply.

That machine language is not seen by the reply recipient, but is distracting to me as I type that reply above the original message

Note too that my reply is in 'normal' text above the machine language of the original message - so I can send normally
creator: danscottprice

title: Import .tar file emails into Thunderbird
content:
My overall intent is to get old emails that are in my Bluehost domain host into a Workspace/Gmail account. From what I've been able to learn, Workspace/Gmail will only allow importing from either Outlook or another Gmail account. So I exported the emails at Bluehost into a cur.tar folder, saved to my computer, and I created a new Gmail account devoted solely to these emails. Thunderbird is apparently required to get the emails imported from the cur.tar file into the new Gmail account.

And that's where I'm stuck. I used the Tbird Import tool, chose 'Import from a File' > 'Import Backed-up Profile' > 'Choose zip file', and the cur.tar zip file is greyed out. I tried expanding that zip file, and it won't allow selecting anything in it.

What am I doing wrong here? Is there a less complicated way to get old emails from Bluehost into Workspace/Gmail?

Edit: A little thoughtful thought brought me to the best, simplest strategy: contact Google's Workspace support. They guided me through the migration process, and it's now done. Sorry for this post...I'd delete it if I could find a way...

title: Can't set up gmail account
content: I have a windows 11 desktop and Thunderbird 140.0.1 (64-bit) loaded. I have two email accounts. One is an AOL account and works perfectly on Thunderbird. The second account is Gmail which was working fine but at the end of May it stopped working on Thunderbird, usually with a timeout error message. I ended up deleting the account and tried to add it back into Thunderbird. When I try it won't add it. Thunderbird spends 3-4 minutes checking password and then gives me an error message that the configuration, password, or email must be wrong (see picture). But the email and password are correct and work every day. The configuration is IMAP, SSL and has the correct goggle addresses and ports. I have tried both OAuth2 and Normal password but still get the same issue. I have deleted the Gmail saved passwords, will allow cookies and my Gmail account allows IMAP. Help Please!

Vyzkoušel jsem všechny dostupná jména a hesla ke všem účtům a stále nic. Někde jsem se dočetl, že je to spojeno s kalendáře. Ale v nastavení thunderbird to nikde nejde zrušit. Kalendáře tam nemám povolené žádné. Prosím o radu co s tím.

title: Constant error message for Gmail calendar event. Can't dismiss or snooze.
content:
Help!

I'm getting constant pop-up notifications for an event on my Gmail calendar, and I can't dismiss or snooze them. I tried deleting the event via my iPhone calendar, where the event was originally created.

It's driving me crazy. I just switched to Thunderbird from Outlook, and I'm ready to abort mission. I can't use Thunderbird if it is going to send me reminders for orphaned or corrupted calendar events I can't dismiss constantly.

Please help!

Here is the error message:

Error Code: MODIFICATION_FAILED

Status Code: 2,147,500,037, null

Server Replied with 400 If you're seeing this message after snoozing or dismissing a reminder and this is for a calendar you do not want to add or edit events for, you can mark this calendar as read-only to avoid such experience in future. To do so, get to the calendar properties by right-clicking on this calendar in the list in the calendar or task view.

title: Can't send email

Please check the message recipient "[concealed]" and try again." Recently I changed the password for my email server account, and I'm suspicious that it is stored in Thunderbird on my computer and needs to be updated. How? When I go to the passwords area, it says "Logins for the following providers are stored on your computer....". I select "show Passwords" and get "verify your identity to reveal saved passwords". I need to enter my master password, which I forget. Now what?

title: Filtering out post-dated emails
content: Over the last month or so I've been been getting a lot of junk which is timestamped with future dates - like 2066 for example. Presumably this is done to promote the message to the 'front' of my inbox. Unfortunately there are now so many of these that I risk overlooking more important mail. Is there any way of filtering out 'impossible' dates I wonder? Any help would be gratefully received! Robin.
creator: orbin
